page.title: 07Housing in Dalgety Bay
page.content: {Dalgety Bay}is only twenty-five years old. It was conceived as a{commuter town for the middle classes, yet this idea has altered since then, with many families moving in from other parts of Britain. Now there are{6500+ inhabitants with further development continuing in the west of the Bay. However concern has grown over the {lack of ammenities}in the area, although the situation has improved somewhat with the building of a new shopping centre in the last two years. The{Industrial Estate}provides many of the inhabitants with jobs. There are two primary schools, with plans for a third. The nearby{Braefoot Bay}Liquid Petroleum Gas terminal has also provided many jobs in managerial and construction positions. There is a thriving{sailing}club on the shore of the Forth.
